storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to assign shift templates to employees to create their schedules

testCases.title: Assign shift templates to employees successfully
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
At least one shift template exists in the system
At least one employee exists in the employee directory
Schedule assignment page is accessible
No existing schedules conflict with the test dates

steps.action: Navigate to schedule assignment page
steps.expectedResult: Page displays employee selector and calendar view with available dates

steps.action: Select one or more employees from the employee directory
steps.expectedResult: Selected employees are highlighted and displayed in the selection panel

steps.action: Select specific dates on the calendar for shift assignment
steps.expectedResult: Selected dates are highlighted on the calendar

steps.action: Choose shift templates from the available templates list and assign to selected employees on the chosen dates
steps.expectedResult: Assignments are displayed on the calendar with employee names and shift details, no validation errors appear

steps.action: Click the Submit or Save button to finalize assignments
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request, schedules are saved successfully, and a confirmation message is displayed

postconditions: Employee schedules are saved in the database
Assigned shifts are visible in the calendar view
Notification trigger is sent to assigned employees
Schedule data is retrievable via API

testCases.title: Detect and prevent overlapping shift assignments
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
At least one employee has an existing shift assignment
Multiple shift templates are available
Schedule assignment page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to schedule assignment page and select an employee who already has a shift assigned
steps.expectedResult: Employee is selected and existing shifts are visible on the calendar

steps.action: Assign a new shift template that overlaps with the employee's existing shift on the same date
steps.expectedResult: System detects the conflict and displays a conflict alert message indicating overlapping shifts with specific time details

steps.action: Attempt to save the conflicting schedule by clicking the Submit or Save button
steps.expectedResult: Save operation is blocked, error message is displayed stating that conflicts must be resolved before saving, and the schedule is not saved to the database

postconditions: No conflicting schedule is saved in the database
Original employee schedule remains unchanged
Conflict alert remains visible until resolved
User can modify or remove the conflicting assignment

testCases.title: Display assigned shifts in calendar view
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role
At least one employee exists in the system
At least one shift template is available
Schedule assignment page is accessible

steps.action: Navigate to schedule assignment page and select an employee
steps.expectedResult: Employee is selected and calendar view is displayed

steps.action: Assign one or more shift templates to the selected employee on specific dates
steps.expectedResult: Shift assignments are created and displayed on the calendar

steps.action: Click Submit or Save button to save the assignments
steps.expectedResult: Assignments are saved successfully with confirmation message displayed

steps.action: View the employee schedule calendar after saving
steps.expectedResult: Assigned shifts are displayed correctly on the calendar with accurate dates, times, shift names, and employee information

steps.action: Verify shift details by clicking on individual shifts in the calendar
steps.expectedResult: Each shift displays complete details including shift template name, start time, end time, role, and assigned employee

postconditions: All assigned shifts are visible in the calendar view
Shift data matches the assigned templates
Calendar displays accurate date and time information
Shifts are retrievable for reporting and employee viewing

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to view my assigned schedule to plan my workdays

testCases.title: Employee views assigned schedule successfully
preconditions: Employee account exists in the system with valid credentials
Employee has at least one shift assigned in the schedule
System is accessible and operational
Employee has not logged in yet

steps.action: Navigate to the system login page and enter valid employee credentials (username and password)
steps.expectedResult: Authentication succeeds, employee is logged in, and the dashboard or home page loads successfully

steps.action: Navigate to 'My Schedule' page from the main menu or dashboard
steps.expectedResult: My Schedule page loads and displays a calendar view with all assigned shifts for the employee

steps.action: Verify that assigned shifts are visible on the calendar with basic information (date, time, shift name)
steps.expectedResult: All assigned shifts are displayed on the correct dates with accurate basic information

steps.action: Click on a specific shift in the calendar to view detailed information
steps.expectedResult: Shift details popup or panel is displayed showing complete information including shift name, start time, end time, role, location, and any additional notes

steps.action: Close the shift details popup and verify calendar remains functional
steps.expectedResult: Popup closes and calendar view remains intact with all shifts still visible

postconditions: Employee remains logged in
Schedule data is displayed accurately
No data modifications have occurred
Employee can continue to navigate the system

testCases.title: Schedule loads within performance requirements
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system
Employee has assigned shifts in the schedule
Network connection is stable
Performance monitoring tool or timer is available

steps.action: Start timer or performance monitoring tool
steps.expectedResult: Timer is started and ready to measure load time

steps.action: Navigate to 'My Schedule' page or click on the schedule menu option
steps.expectedResult: Schedule page begins loading

steps.action: Measure the time from navigation click until the schedule calendar is fully rendered with all shift data visible
steps.expectedResult: Schedule data loads completely and is displayed within 2 seconds, meeting the performance requirement

steps.action: Verify that all shifts are visible and interactive after the load completes
steps.expectedResult: All assigned shifts are displayed correctly and calendar is fully functional

postconditions: Schedule page is fully loaded
Performance requirement of 2 seconds is met
All schedule data is accessible
Page remains responsive for further interactions

testCases.title: Notifications display for schedule changes
preconditions: Employee account exists and is logged into the system
Employee has at least one assigned shift
Scheduler has access to modify employee schedules
Notification system is enabled and functional

steps.action: Scheduler logs in and navigates to schedule management page
steps.expectedResult: Scheduler successfully accesses the schedule management interface

steps.action: Scheduler selects the employee's existing schedule and makes a modification (change shift time, date, or assignment)
steps.expectedResult: Schedule modification is accepted by the system

steps.action: Scheduler saves the updated schedule
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is saved successfully and notification trigger is sent to the affected employee

steps.action: Employee views the notification center or notification icon in the system
steps.expectedResult: New notification is visible indicating a schedule change has occurred

steps.action: Employee clicks on the notification to view details
steps.expectedResult: Notification content is displayed showing accurate information about the schedule change including what was changed, old values, new values, and effective date. Notification includes actionable link to view updated schedule

steps.action: Click on the actionable link in the notification
steps.expectedResult: Employee is navigated to 'My Schedule' page showing the updated schedule with changes highlighted or indicated

postconditions: Notification is marked as read or viewed
Employee is aware of schedule changes
Updated schedule is displayed in calendar view
Notification remains in history for future reference

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive alerts for scheduling conflicts to prevent errors

testCases.title: Detect overlapping shift conflicts during scheduling
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role permissions
Schedule management interface is accessible
At least one employee exists in the system
Employee has no existing shifts assigned for the test time period

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule management interface
steps.expectedResult: Schedule management interface loads successfully with employee list visible

steps.action: Select an employee from the employee list
steps.expectedResult: Employee is selected and available for shift assignment

steps.action: Assign a shift to the employee (e.g., Monday 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM)
steps.expectedResult: First shift is assigned successfully without any alerts

steps.action: Assign a second overlapping shift to the same employee (e.g., Monday 3:00 PM - 11:00 PM)
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alert is displayed immediately indicating overlapping shift times with specific details of the conflict

steps.action: Review the conflict alert message
steps.expectedResult: Alert clearly shows both conflicting shift times and identifies the overlap period

steps.action: Attempt to save the schedule with the unresolved conflict
steps.expectedResult: Save action is blocked and error message is displayed stating that conflicts must be resolved before saving

postconditions: Schedule is not saved due to unresolved conflict
Conflict alert remains visible on screen
Employee still has only the first shift assigned
System remains in edit mode awaiting conflict resolution

testCases.title: Enforce minimum rest period between shifts
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role permissions
Schedule management interface is accessible
Minimum rest period policy is configured in the system (e.g., 8 hours between shifts)
At least one employee exists in the system
Employee has no existing shifts assigned for the test time period

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule management interface
steps.expectedResult: Schedule management interface loads successfully

steps.action: Select an employee from the employee list
steps.expectedResult: Employee is selected and ready for shift assignment

steps.action: Assign a shift to the employee (e.g., Monday 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM)
steps.expectedResult: First shift is assigned successfully without alerts

steps.action: Assign a second shift that violates the minimum rest period (e.g., Monday 9:00 PM - Tuesday 5:00 AM, only 4 hours rest)
steps.expectedResult: Alert is displayed immediately indicating rest period violation with specific details about required vs actual rest time

steps.action: Review the rest period violation alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert clearly states the minimum rest period requirement and the actual time between shifts

steps.action: Adjust the second shift to comply with rest period policy (e.g., change to Tuesday 1:00 AM - 9:00 AM, providing 8 hours rest)
steps.expectedResult: Alert disappears immediately and no validation errors are shown

steps.action: Attempt to save the schedule
steps.expectedResult: Schedule saves successfully with confirmation message displayed

postconditions: Schedule is saved successfully with both shifts
No conflict alerts are displayed
Employee has two shifts assigned with compliant rest period between them
Audit log records the schedule creation

testCases.title: Revalidate conflicts after schedule adjustments
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role permissions
Schedule management interface is accessible
At least one employee exists in the system
Employee has an existing schedule with a conflict (overlapping shifts or rest period violation)

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule management interface
steps.expectedResult: Schedule management interface loads with existing schedule visible

steps.action: View the schedule with existing conflicts
steps.expectedResult: Conflict alerts are displayed for the existing scheduling conflicts

steps.action: Select one of the conflicting shifts for editing
steps.expectedResult: Shift details are displayed in editable form

steps.action: Modify the shift time to resolve the conflict (e.g., change end time to eliminate overlap)
steps.expectedResult: System rechecks conflicts in real-time and conflict alert disappears immediately

steps.action: Verify that no conflict alerts are displayed
steps.expectedResult: All conflict alerts have been cleared and schedule shows as valid

steps.action: Make an additional minor adjustment to another shift (non-conflicting change)
steps.expectedResult: System revalidates all shifts in real-time and confirms no new conflicts introduced

steps.action: Save the schedule after resolving all conflicts
steps.expectedResult: Schedule saves successfully with confirmation message displayed

steps.action: Verify the saved schedule
steps.expectedResult: All shifts are saved correctly with no conflicts and updated times are reflected

postconditions: Schedule is saved successfully without any conflicts
All conflict alerts have been resolved and cleared
Employee shifts are updated with adjusted times
System displays confirmation of successful save
Audit log records the schedule modifications

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to manually adjust assigned shifts to handle exceptions

testCases.title: Edit assigned shift successfully with validation
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role permissions
Schedule management interface is accessible
At least one employee exists with assigned shifts
Employee has at least one shift assigned that can be edited
No existing conflicts in the current schedule

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule management interface
steps.expectedResult: Schedule management interface loads successfully showing list of assigned shifts

steps.action: Locate an assigned shift in the schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Assigned shift is visible with current details (employee name, date, time, role)

steps.action: Select the assigned shift for editing by clicking on it
steps.expectedResult: Shift details are displayed in an editable form with all fields populated (start time, end time, role, employee)

steps.action: Modify the shift start time to a valid new time (e.g., change from 9:00 AM to 10:00 AM)
steps.expectedResult: Start time field updates with the new value and no validation errors are shown

steps.action: Modify the shift end time to a valid new time (e.g., change from 5:00 PM to 6:00 PM)
steps.expectedResult: End time field updates with the new value and no validation errors are shown

steps.action: Modify the role assignment if applicable (e.g., change from 'Cashier' to 'Floor Staff')
steps.expectedResult: Role field updates with the new value and no validation errors are shown

steps.action: Review all modified fields to ensure changes are correct
steps.expectedResult: All fields display the updated values correctly

steps.action: Click the Save button to save the changes
steps.expectedResult: Shift is updated successfully and confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Shift updated successfully')

steps.action: Verify the updated shift in the schedule view
steps.expectedResult: Schedule displays the shift with all updated details (new times and role)

postconditions: Shift is updated with new times and role in the database
Schedule view reflects the updated shift details
Confirmation message is displayed to the user
Audit log contains entry with user ID, timestamp, and details of the modification
No conflicts exist in the schedule

testCases.title: Prevent saving adjustments with conflicts
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role permissions
Schedule management interface is accessible
At least one employee exists with assigned shifts
Employee has at least two shifts assigned on different times
Current schedule has no conflicts

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule management interface
steps.expectedResult: Schedule management interface loads successfully with assigned shifts visible

steps.action: Select an assigned shift for editing
steps.expectedResult: Shift details are displayed in editable form with current values

steps.action: Modify the shift time to create an overlap with another existing shift for the same employee (e.g., change shift from 9:00 AM - 5:00 PM to 2:00 PM - 10:00 PM when employee already has a shift from 6:00 PM - 11:00 PM)
steps.expectedResult: Validation error is displayed immediately indicating the conflict with specific details about the overlapping shifts

steps.action: Review the validation error message
steps.expectedResult: Error message clearly identifies the conflicting shifts with times and explains the overlap

steps.action: Attempt to save the changes by clicking the Save button
steps.expectedResult: Save action is blocked and error message is displayed stating 'Cannot save shift with unresolved conflicts' or similar

steps.action: Verify that the Save button is disabled or the save action shows an error
steps.expectedResult: Save functionality is prevented and user cannot proceed until conflict is resolved

steps.action: Modify the shift again to remove the conflict (e.g., change end time to 5:00 PM to eliminate overlap)
steps.expectedResult: Validation error disappears and no conflict messages are shown

steps.action: Attempt to save the changes again
steps.expectedResult: Shift saves successfully with confirmation message displayed

postconditions: Shift is saved only after conflict resolution
No conflicting shifts exist in the schedule
Validation errors are cleared after successful save
Schedule reflects the corrected shift times
Audit log records the successful adjustment

testCases.title: Verify audit trail records manual adjustments
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role permissions
Schedule management interface is accessible
Audit log system is functioning and accessible
At least one employee exists with assigned shifts
User has permissions to view audit logs
System timestamp is accurate

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule management interface
steps.expectedResult: Schedule management interface loads successfully

steps.action: Note the current timestamp before making changes
steps.expectedResult: Current system time is recorded for verification purposes

steps.action: Select an assigned shift for editing
steps.expectedResult: Shift details are displayed in editable form

steps.action: Make a manual adjustment to the shift (e.g., change start time from 9:00 AM to 10:00 AM)
steps.expectedResult: Shift time is updated in the form with no validation errors

steps.action: Save the changes by clicking the Save button
steps.expectedResult: Adjustment is saved successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Navigate to the audit log interface or section
steps.expectedResult: Audit log interface loads successfully showing list of recent activities

steps.action: Query or filter audit logs for the specific shift adjustment (using shift ID, employee name, or time range)
steps.expectedResult: Audit log displays filtered results relevant to the recent adjustment

steps.action: Locate the audit entry for the manual adjustment just made
steps.expectedResult: Audit entry exists in the log for the shift modification

steps.action: Verify the audit entry contains the user ID or username who made the change
steps.expectedResult: Audit entry shows correct user identification matching the logged-in scheduler

steps.action: Verify the audit entry contains an accurate timestamp of when the change was made
steps.expectedResult: Timestamp in audit entry matches the time when the save action was performed (within acceptable margin)

steps.action: Verify the audit entry contains details of what was changed (old value vs new value)
steps.expectedResult: Audit entry shows the previous shift time (9:00 AM) and new shift time (10:00 AM) along with any other modified fields

steps.action: Verify the audit entry contains the action type (e.g., 'Shift Updated' or 'Manual Adjustment')
steps.expectedResult: Audit entry clearly identifies the type of action performed

postconditions: Shift adjustment is saved in the database
Complete audit trail entry exists with all required information
Audit log contains user ID/username of the scheduler who made the change
Audit log contains accurate timestamp of the modification
Audit log contains before and after values of the modified shift
Audit log is accessible for compliance and tracking purposes

storyTitle: As Scheduler, I want to receive notifications when schedules are created or changed to keep employees informed

testCases.title: Verify automatic notification on schedule creation
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role and has appropriate permissions
At least one employee exists in the system with valid email address
Notification service is running and configured properly
System time is synchronized for accurate timestamp tracking

steps.action: Navigate to the schedule creation page
steps.expectedResult: Schedule creation page loads successfully with all required fields visible

steps.action: Select an employee from the employee dropdown list
steps.expectedResult: Employee is selected and displayed in the schedule form

steps.action: Enter schedule details including date, time, shift type, and location
steps.expectedResult: All schedule details are entered and validated without errors

steps.action: Click the 'Save' or 'Create Schedule' button
steps.expectedResult: Schedule is saved successfully and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Note the current timestamp and wait for up to 1 minute
steps.expectedResult: System triggers notification automatically within 1 minute of schedule creation

steps.action: Verify notification delivery status in the scheduler dashboard or notification log
steps.expectedResult: Notification status shows as 'Sent' or 'Delivered' with timestamp within 1 minute of schedule creation

steps.action: Check employee's email inbox or system alert panel
steps.expectedResult: Employee receives notification via email or system alert

steps.action: Review the notification content received by the employee
steps.expectedResult: Notification contains accurate schedule details including employee name, date, time, shift type, and location matching the created schedule

postconditions: New schedule is created and stored in the database
Notification is sent and logged in the notification tracking system
Employee has received notification with accurate schedule information
Notification delivery status is available for scheduler review

testCases.title: Resend notification manually
preconditions: User is logged in with Scheduler role and has appropriate permissions
At least one schedule exists with a previously sent notification
Notification tracking system is operational
Scheduler has access to notification status interface

steps.action: Navigate to the scheduler dashboard or notification management section
steps.expectedResult: Dashboard or notification management page loads successfully

steps.action: Locate and access the notification status view or notification history
steps.expectedResult: Notification status interface is displayed with list of sent notifications

steps.action: View the notification status for a specific schedule
steps.expectedResult: Delivery status is displayed showing details such as 'Sent', 'Delivered', 'Failed', timestamp, recipient, and schedule information

steps.action: Identify a notification that needs to be resent and locate the resend option
steps.expectedResult: Resend notification button or link is visible and enabled for the selected notification

steps.action: Click the 'Resend Notification' button
steps.expectedResult: System prompts for confirmation or immediately processes the resend request

steps.action: Confirm the resend action if prompted
steps.expectedResult: Notification is resent to the employee and confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Refresh or check the notification status view
steps.expectedResult: Notification status is updated showing new 'Resent' status with updated timestamp and delivery confirmation

steps.action: Verify employee receives the resent notification
steps.expectedResult: Employee receives duplicate notification via email or system alert with same schedule details

postconditions: Notification is resent and logged in the notification tracking system
Notification status is updated with resend timestamp and delivery status
Employee has received the resent notification
Notification history shows both original and resent notification records

testCases.title: Ensure notification privacy and security
preconditions: Multiple user accounts exist with different roles (Scheduler, Employee, Unauthorized user)
At least one schedule with notifications exists in the system
Authentication and authorization mechanisms are properly configured
Test user account without notification access permissions is available

steps.action: Log out from any existing session
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged out and redirected to login page

steps.action: Log in with an unauthorized user account (user without scheduler or notification access permissions)
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and logged into the system with limited permissions

steps.action: Attempt to navigate directly to the notification status page or notification management URL
steps.expectedResult: Access is denied with appropriate error message such as '403 Forbidden' or 'Access Denied - Insufficient Permissions'

steps.action: Attempt to access notification details via API endpoint or direct link if available
steps.expectedResult: API returns authorization error (401 or 403) and access is blocked

steps.action: Search for any navigation menu items or links related to notifications
steps.expectedResult: Notification management options are not visible or accessible in the user interface for unauthorized user

steps.action: Attempt to view another employee's notification details by manipulating URL parameters or request data
steps.expectedResult: System validates authorization and denies access, preventing unauthorized viewing of notification data

steps.action: Log out and log in with a Scheduler role account
steps.expectedResult: Scheduler user can successfully access notification status and management features

steps.action: Verify that notification content does not expose sensitive information to unauthorized parties
steps.expectedResult: Notification privacy is maintained and only authorized users can access notification details

postconditions: Unauthorized access attempts are logged in security audit logs
No notification data is exposed to unauthorized users
System security and privacy controls are validated as functioning correctly
Authorized users retain proper access to notification features
